fields.descriptive_line: Model pieces for the model for Act I scene 1 and Act II of the ballet "The Sailor's Return", choreographed and designed by Andrée Howard, premiered by Ballet Rambert at Sadler's Wells Theatre in 1947.
fields.physical_description:
[set model] Model piece for opposite prompt flat I (tree).  
Shaped flat in the form of a tree, painted in shades of brown with green foliage to the top.  The flat is scored to be folded back about one third from the left, where it is painted brown grey.  
Inscribed with measurements and on the reverse with directions to the set painter.
[set model] Model piece for opposite prompt flat 1 (cottage). 
Cut-out cottage with side extension to left, with white walls with painted shadows and some brick showing at ground level, brown chimney, roof and door and grey windows with white glazing bars; to the left of the chimney, green foliage.  The door is cut to side and top and the right-hand downstairs window cut out.  Painted to right side, between the upper and lower windows, "Mrs Frickif Modifte" in a cartouche.  The flat is scored to left of centre.  Gouache and pencil.  
Inscribed on reverse with directions to set builder.
[set model] Model piece for opposite prompt flat 2 (cottage).  
Cut-out cottage with slate-coloured roof, grey windows and door and brown chimney, to the left of which green foliage.  The door has been cut up left side and top.  The flat has been scored to left of centre.  Part of the foliage is painted separately and fixed to the back with adhesive and tape. Gouache and pencil.  
Inscribed on reverse with identification.
[set model] Model piece for ground row in the form of a wall.  
Cut-out wall irregularly sloping from left to right, painted to simulate grey stone.  
Inscribed on reverse with instructions to set builder, marking out the rostrum area to be built behind the flat.
[set model] Model piece for prompt side flat 2 (house). 
Cut-out flat in the shape of a house with overhanging upper storey, the roof painted brown yellow, the walls white and the windows grey with white lattice. The flat is scored to right of centre.  Gouache, wash and pencil.  
Inscribed on the reverse with identification.
[set model] Model piece for prompt side flat 1 (house) 
Cut-out flat in the form of a house, the roof sloping down left, with yellow-brown roof, white walls painted with shadows, green door shaded black, upper grey window with white lattice and cut-out lower window with cut-out lattice; the door is cut up left side and across the top and reinforced at the back with adhesive tape down the uncut side.  Fixed to the upper left side with tape is a wrought iron support from which hangs an inn sign featuring two figures and a ship; the support is held at the back with adhesive tape.  At the right side, the sheet is extended to the level of the upper window and painted in shades of grey; the extension is scored where it meets the main wall.  Gouache, wash and pencil.  
Inscribed on reverse with identification and sketch of a porch.
[set model] Model piece for prompt side No I flat (tree).  
Shaped flat in the form of a tree, painted in shades of brown with green foliage to the top.  The flat is scored to be folded back about one third from the right, where it is painted brown grey with the extreme lower right corner unpainted.  
Inscribed with measurements and on the reverse with directions to the set painter.
[set model] Model piece for border 3 (sky) 
Sky border, curved at lower edge, painted in shades of blue, blue grey and mauve with tree branches and green foliage to right hand side.  The upper edge is unpainted.  The border consists of two pieces joined in the centre at the back with tape.  Gouache and pencil.  
Inscribed on front and reverse with identification.
[set model] Model piece for border 2 (sky and trees)
Sky border, curved and shaped at lower edge, the sky painted in shades of blue, blue grey and mauve with tree branches and green foliage to either side.  The border consists of two pieces joined in the centre at the back with tape.  Gouache and pencil.  
Inscribed on reverse with identification.
[set model] Model piece for border 1 (trees)
Border, curved and shaped at lower edge, with trees to either side, the branches and green foliage, highlighted in yellow at right side, meeting at centre.  Gouache and pencil.  
On reverse remains of previous watercolour sketch.  
Inscribed on reverse with identification.

fields.history_note:
The model is for Act I scene 1 and Act II of the ballet "The Sailor's Return", choreographed and designed by Andrée Howard to a score by Arthur Oldham and premiered by Ballet Rambert at Sadler's Wells Theatre in 1947.   
Howard devised the scenario from the novel of the same name by David Garnett, producing a ballet in six scenes.  The ballet traces the events set in train when the sailor, William Targett, returns to his home village with Tulip, a negro girl he has married in a native ceremony; the prejudice they encounter leads to his death and Tulip sends their child away to be brought up in Africa. 
The design came to the Museum as part of a gift from Maude Lloyd, who was a close friend and colleague of Andrée Howard.

Historical significance: "The Sailor's Return" was an example of dance drama, rather than pure ballet, and the second time that Howard had turned to David Garnett's novels as a source, the first being for one of her finest works, "Lady into Fox".  The role of Tulip provided Sally Gilmour with one of her finest roles.  
Howard was one of a very few choreographers who also designed their own ballets.
